Description: Conical foot sherd of Chian pottery chalice; white slip on exterior, glazed streaky black (fired brown) with traces of added white bands; edge of foot reserved; trace of slip on underside; inscription on underside.
Curator's comments: The number 375 is written in pencil on the interior surface of the sherd. The incline of the foot suggests that it is later than those from the Wild Goat Style. the thickness of the sherd suggests that it might be from an Mature Animal Style or Grand Style chalice.
Bibliographic references: Johnston 2006a / Trademarks on Greek Vases: Addenda (p. 170, no. 48) (wrongly noted as a trademark)
Villing et al 2013-2015 / Naukratis: Greeks in Egypt (GD.0647) (phase 2)
